n-to-skin contact 
with your baby as soon as 
possible after the birth. This 
will help with bonding and 
keeping up your milk supply.
Baby units often have 
breast pump machines for 
expressing	milk,	and	staff	will	
show you how to use one. If 
you go home from hospital 
before your baby you may 
need to use an electric breast 
pump for many weeks.
You can borrow a breast pump 
from Tiny Life the premature 
baby charity by contacting 
them on 028 90815050.
If you want 
to freeze
